@graph.reasoning: The right to copy, and to copy without attribution, once a copyright has expired, like 'the right to make [an article whose patent has expired]-including the right to make it in precisely the shape it carried when patented-passes to the public.'
The right to make an article whose patent has expired passes to the public.
Unless an intellectual property right such as a patent or copyright protects an item, it will be subject to copying.
In general, unless an intellectual property right such as a patent or copyright protects an item, it will be subject to copying.
The rights of a patentee or copyright holder are part of a 'carefully crafted bargain.'
Federal trademark law 'has no necessary relation to invention or discovery.'
Congress has wished to create an addition to the law of copyright with much more specificity than the Lanham Act's ambiguous use of 'origin.'
